brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the digital signal on three basic forms of network media: copper cable, fiber, and wireless.

Copper cable signals: A line moves up and down indicating changes in voltage levels to represent digital zeros and ones.

Fiber-optic signals: Light wave pulses vary, representing digital zeros and ones.

Microwave and wireless signals: Analog electromagnetic waves vary in frequency (Frequency Modulation - FM), amplitude (Amplitude Modulation - AM) and phase (Phase Modulation - PM) to represent radio signals or digital zeros and ones.
